name: bow
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to bend your head or body forward, especially as a way of showing someone respect or expressing thanks to people who have watched you perform: bow to They bowed to the Queen.bow your head We bowed our heads in prayer. He stood at the back, head bowed in silent contemplation.bow down He bowed down before (= in front of) the king and begged for mercy. Compare
curtsy verb
More examplesFewer examplesThey bowed deferentially as she came into the room.The children bowed their heads in shame.The Princess, visibly moved, kept her head bowed during the ceremony.They had to bow to the Prince.She bowed down before the King.

[ U ] in the sport of rowing, the rowing position closest to the front of the boat: She has moved from the number 5 seat to row at bow. The man in the bow seat is the youngest in the crew.
[ C usually singular ] in the sport of rowing, the person sitting closest to the front of the boat: He was bow in his University's eight.
